snippet: Both sides in the debate over the Keystone XL pipeline find support for their positions in an updated State Department analysis that assesses greater risk of death and injury if more oil is moved by rail from Canada.
abstract: State Department analysis reports if the Keystone XL pipeline is not built, and more oil from the Canadian oil sands is moved by rail, there could be hundreds more deaths and thousands more injuries than expected over the course of a decade; State Dept has authority to approve pipeline because it would cross international borders, although Pres Obama is expected to make ultimate call.
lead_paragraph: Both sides in the debate over the Keystone XL pipeline find support for their positions in an updated State Department analysis that assesses greater risk of death and injury if more oil is moved by rail from Canada.

headline.main: Report Finds Higher Risks if Oil Line Is Not Built
headline.print_headline: Report Finds Higher Risks if Oil Line Is Not Built
